alert.note: Alert for Flathead (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 02 at 6:28PM MST until March 02 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: The National Weather Service in Missoula has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... West central Flathead County in northwestern Montana... * Until 715 PM MST. * At 627 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 16 miles west of Kalispell to 20 miles southwest of Evergreen, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Flash freeze on roads. Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 98 and 125. Highway 83 near mile marker 90. Highway 93 N between mile markers 100 and 116. Locations impacted include... Kalispell, Evergreen, Bigfork, Kila, Somers, Creston and Marion. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges, and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for a sudden loss of traction. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
